Jake has $x$ peaches. Steven has $x+5$ peaches. Jill has $x+5+18= x+23$ peaches. 

$\therefore$ Jake has $x$ peaches. Jill has $87-x$ peaches.

$\therefore$ Jake has more peaches than Jill if and only if $x \gt 87-x$, $2x \gt 87$ and $x \gt 43$.

Steven has more peaches than Jill if and only if $x+5 \gt x+23$, $5-18 \gt x$, $-13 \gt x$ and $x \lt 13$.

$\therefore$ Steven has more peaches than Jill and Jake has more peaches than Jill if and only if $x \lt 13$ and $x \gt 43$.

$\therefore$ If $x=74$ then Jake has 74 peaches and Jill has 13 peaches, then Jake has 61 more peaches than Jill.

**Answer: The possible answer 74 is correct and the answer confidence is 100%.**
